org.csstudio.scan.command
Class CommandSequence

java.lang.Object
  org.csstudio.scan.command.CommandSequence

public class CommandSequence
extends java.lang.Object

Helper for creating a sequence of commands

Used by the client to building a sequence of commands which is then submitted to the server for execution as a "scan".

Allows both List<Command> and plain Command[]. For Java code collections like List are most convenient. Jython nicely converts existing collections into a python list, but it is harder to create collections from a python list, so arrays are also accepted.

Constructor Detail

CommandSequence

public CommandSequence()
Initialize empty command sequence to which commands can then be added.

CommandSequence

public CommandSequence(ScanCommand commands)
Initialize with a command.

This constructor simplifies invocation from Matlab. In principle, the "ScanCommand..." constructor handles zero, one, many commands, i.e. all cases. Matlab, however, turns a single-element array into a scalar in a way incompatible with the var-length argument constructor.

Parameters:
commands - Sequence of commands

CommandSequence

public CommandSequence(ScanCommand... commands)
Initialize with a given sequence of commands.

The command sequence is then immutable.

Parameters:
commands - Sequence of commands
